The Senate just passed the #HongKong Human Rights & Democracy Act, sending a strong signal that we stand with those in Hong Kong pushing for their fundamental rights and freedoms. Now, let’s send this to the President’s desk. America can and must be on the right side of history.
Amazon is not doing enough to ensure that its products and practices do not run afoul of our civil liberties.

Ring has:

-no security requirements for law enforcement that gets access to users’ footage

-no restrictions on law enforcement sharing users’ footage with third parties

-no policies that prohibit law enforcement from keeping shared video footage forever

This is nothing short of chilling. Amazon Ring’s policies are an open door for privacy and civil liberty violations. Ring is marketed to help keep families safe, but privacy rights are in real danger as a result of company policies. https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/11/19/police-can-keep-ring-camera-video-forever-share-with-whomever-theyd-like-company-tells-senator …

With the Turkey Human Rights Promotion Act, we can send a message to the people of Turkey: we will not rest until you have the rights to which you are entitled.

The Turkish government also heavily restricts and censors the internet, blocking more than 220,000 websites including Wikipedia – and temporarily including Twitter and YouTube. It is now pressuring Netflix and other online streaming platforms to censor content.

By the end of 2018, the Government of Turkey had:

-Arrested or imprisoned more than 80,000 Turkish citizens 

-Closed more than 1,500 nongovernmental organizations on terrorism-related grounds

-Dismissed or suspended more than 130,000 civil servants from their jobs
Erdogan has forcibly closed at least 180 media outlets in the past three years, and was detaining at least 68 journalists and media workers at the end of 2018.

Yesterday, Enes joined Senator @RonWyden and I to introduce the Turkey Human Rights Promotion Act to condemn Erdogan’s crackdown on free speech and human rights and support those resisting it.
 
Brutal leaders like Erdogan need to be called out, not invited in to the White House.

“It’s bigger than myself, it’s bigger than the NBA, it’s bigger than basketball,” - @EnesKanter
